page.title: 05Living in an Oast House
page.content: My family and I first came to live in an oast house in 1982.It was once owned by Whitbread. My dad has worked very hard turning it into a house. The roundel was used for drying the hops to make beer.We now use the roundel as our dining room and above is my mum and dad's bedroom. We still have the hop press in our house which was used to hang a large sack called a hop pocket. In what is now our garage there are dates and numbers stamped on the beams.The numbers tell us how many hop pockets were in our oast each year. When it was being used in 1930 there were 384 hop pockets. I do like living in an oast house. There's a lot of room.We have six bedrooms,three bathrooms,a dining room,a sitting room and large kitchen.
